::Shadow Wing::

She wandered into the eingine room.  She looked at all the damage 
that the ship has sustained.  She shook her head.  She wondered how 
they would ever manage to repair this much damage to the once great 
ship.

She turned the corner and saw Lunarpine laying on the floor all 
curled up.  He looked like he was lost in thought.  She stood there a 
moment looking at him.  She always thought of him a majestic and 
regal creature.  She smiled while looking at him.  No matter what, 
she always felt safe with him.  Even when they sparred or just 
talked. She loved being around him.  She found that she couldn't help 
herself but care for him.

She looked at him and noticed something else.  She thought he looked 
lonely.  Not for friends or anything, but the companionship of anther 
wolf.  She knew how he felt.  She too missed the commpany of other 
owls.  

She turned and walked away.  She hoped that he had not noticed her.  
She wanted to help him. She looked down at her body and thought a 
moment. Then a huge smile appeared on her face.
She ran down the hall and into the repair bay.  If her landing pod 
could change her form into an owl, why not into a wolf.  She about 
the repair bay looking for an old pod with a form scanner still in 
operational order.


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Lunarpine curled up in the engine room, The Arks frame full of 
holes 
> there too, much like the rest of the ship. He didn't know how the 
> Maximals would set the timeline straight, but everything must have 
> turned out right, he still existed. 
> 
> It was later in the day, the sun wasn't beating down as much. He 
was 
> lonely. A lone wolf in a pack, a duck without a flocking group to 
> join. (It's a comparison, he didn't accualy turn into a duck.) He 
> remembered his first day as a wolf, the pack recognized him as 
alien 
> to thier group and chased him off.
> 
> "Theres gotta be others" he said out loud to himself remembering 
> Striker. If Striker existed then why not other wolves? If not for 
his 
> pledge of loyalty as it was, to Ramulus he'd set out right now to 
> find his answers. Duty came first, before friendship, before 
> information, even before his own personal feelings.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > ::Shadow Wing::
> > 
> > She stepped out of the chamber.  She looked around for Lunarpine, 
> but 
> > he wasn't there.
> > "Now where did that wolf wander off to."
> > She started walking around the ship looking for him.
